definitions.definition: A formal solemn objection or other declaration .

A declaration in common-law pleading, by which the party interposes an oblique allegation or denial of some fact, protesting that it does or does not exist, and at the same time avoiding a direct affirmation or denial.

main_definition: A formal solemn objection or other declaration .
secondary_definitions: ( law , historical ) A declaration in common-law pleading, by which the party interposes an oblique allegation or denial of some fact, protesting that it does or does not exist, and at the same time avoiding a direct affirmation or denial.
